name: Add a Letter to Make a New Word Quiz  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which letter can you add to the beginning of the word EAR to make a period of 365 days?
questions.explanation:
Y.

	An ear is an organ you hear with. Add a Y to the beginning and you get 365 days, or 12 months; a year.

questions.text: Which letter can you add to the beginning of the word AT to get a word meaning to consume?
questions.explanation:
E.

	At means a location, like at the store. Add an E to this word and you get eat, which is a word meaning to consume.

questions.text: Which letter can you add to the beginning of the word LIP to get a word meaning to fall?
questions.explanation:
S.

	A lip is part of your face around your mouth. Add an S to this and you get a word for fall; slip.

questions.text: Which letter can you add to the beginning of the word RAIN to get a form of transportation?
questions.explanation:
T.

	Rain is water that falls from the sky. When you put a T in front of it, you get train. Train can mean a vehicle that drives on s track, a bride's long flowing dress, or a verb that means to teach.

questions.text: Which letter can you add to the beginning of the word ASTER to make a holiday?
questions.explanation:
E.

	An aster is a type of flower. When you add an E to the beginning, you get Easter, a holiday associated with rabbits and eggs.

questions.text: Which letter can you add to the beginning of the word ASH to get a word meaning an itchy red spot on your skin?
questions.explanation:
R.

	Ash is created by things burned by a fire, and is also a type of tree. Add an R to the word to get an itchy red spot, such as a rash babies might get from their diaper.

questions.text: Which letter can you add to the beginning of the word ONE to mean finished?
questions.explanation:
D.

	One is a number representing a single item. Add a D to this word to get done, which means to be finished.

questions.text: Which letter can you add to the beginning of the word MAZE to mean surprise?
questions.explanation:
A.

	A maze is a type of puzzle where you begin in one spot and must find your way out by going through a certain path. Add an A to the word to get amaze, which means to surprise or shock.

questions.text: Which letter can you add to the beginning of the word EAST to get something that helps bread rise?
questions.explanation:
Y.

	East is one of the four directions; north, east, south, and west. If you add a Y to the word, you get the word for a type of mold that causes dough to expand so your bread becomes fluffier.

questions.text:
What word can you spell by using the answers, in order, of the first nine questions?

Hint: it's not today.
questions.explanation:
Yesterday.

	Using the letters from the first nine correct answers, you can spell YESTERDAY, a word meaning the day before today. The wrong answers also spell words, but, of course, they're wrong! Y - earE - atS - lipT - rainE - asterR - ashD - oneA - mazeY - east
